import Mathlib.Tactic
import Mathlib.Analysis.Convex.Function
import Mathlib.Data.Real.EReal
import Mathlib.Topology.Basic
import Mathlib.Topology.Sequences
import Mathlib.Order.Filter.Basic
import Mathlib.Order.LiminfLimsup

import Mathlib.Logic.Basic

import Mathlib.Topology.Bases

import Mathlib.Order.Bounds.Basic
import Mathlib.Analysis.Convex.Basic
import Mathlib.Topology.SubsetProperties
import Mathlib.Analysis.NormedSpace.Ray
import Mathlib.Topology.MetricSpace.Basic
import Mathlib.Analysis.NormedSpace.ENorm


open EReal Function Topology Filter Set TopologicalSpace

variable {ğ•œ E Î± Î² Î¹ : Type _}

variable [LinearOrderedRing ğ•œ] [DenselyOrdered ğ•œ]

variable [AddCommMonoid E]

variable (ğ•œ) (s : Set E) (f : E â†’ EReal)[SMul ğ•œ E]

example : (1 : ğ•œ ) â€¢ (x' : E) = (x' : E) := by
  rw[one_smul (b := x')]

Does anyone know why the error occurs: tactic 'rewrite' failed, equality or iff proof expected ?m.1339

I get two errors, the other one being:

failed to synthesize instance
  Monoid M

This means Lean can't assign a type to one_smul (b := x'), which then causes the error in rw. If you fix the "failed to synthesize instance" error, the rw error should also go away.

Anne Baanen said:

I get two errors, the other one being:

failed to synthesize instance
  Monoid M

This means Lean can't assign a type to one_smul (b := x'), which then causes the error in rw. If you fix the "failed to synthesize instance" error, the rw error should also go away.

Should I modify the definition of E? If so, how should I modify it?

Here's how I got it to work, with comments explaining what I changed.

variable {ğ•œ E Î± Î² Î¹ : Type _}

variable [LinearOrderedRing ğ•œ] [DenselyOrdered ğ•œ]

variable [AddCommMonoid E]

variable (ğ•œ) -- To make ğ•œ explicit, put it on a separate line. Otherwise Lean defines a new ğ•œ
variable (s : Set E) (f : E â†’ EReal) [MulAction ğ•œ E] -- Upgrade SMul ğ•œ E to MulAction ğ•œ E

example : (1 : ğ•œ ) â€¢ (x' : E) = (x' : E) := by
  rw[one_smul ğ•œ (b := x')] -- Pass ğ•œ explicitly
I must say that I find the meaning of variable (ğ•œ) depending on the remainder of the variable line quite unintuitive, and the error reported by rw should be made clearer.

Anne Baanen said:

Here's how I got it to work, with comments explaining what I changed.

variable {ğ•œ E Î± Î² Î¹ : Type _}

variable [LinearOrderedRing ğ•œ] [DenselyOrdered ğ•œ]

variable [AddCommMonoid E]

variable (ğ•œ) -- To make ğ•œ explicit, put it on a separate line. Otherwise Lean defines a new ğ•œ
variable (s : Set E) (f : E â†’ EReal) [MulAction ğ•œ E] -- Upgrade SMul ğ•œ E to MulAction ğ•œ E

example : (1 : ğ•œ ) â€¢ (x' : E) = (x' : E) := by
  rw[one_smul ğ•œ (b := x')] -- Pass ğ•œ explicitly

Thank you. In fact, this example is a part of a large proof. It is strange that I still canâ€™t write this way in that relatively large proof. I wonder if it is because the E is not good enough?

tsuki hao said:

Anne Baanen said:

Here's how I got it to work, with comments explaining what I changed.

variable {ğ•œ E Î± Î² Î¹ : Type _}

variable [LinearOrderedRing ğ•œ] [DenselyOrdered ğ•œ]

variable [AddCommMonoid E]

variable (ğ•œ) -- To make ğ•œ explicit, put it on a separate line. Otherwise Lean defines a new ğ•œ
variable (s : Set E) (f : E â†’ EReal) [MulAction ğ•œ E] -- Upgrade SMul ğ•œ E to MulAction ğ•œ E

example : (1 : ğ•œ ) â€¢ (x' : E) = (x' : E) := by
  rw[one_smul ğ•œ (b := x')] -- Pass ğ•œ explicitly

Thank you. In fact, this example is a part of a large proof. It is strange that I still canâ€™t write this way in that relatively large proof. I wonder if it is because the E is not good enough?

In that proof its error is: failed to synthesize instance Mul Action ğ•œ E

Do I understand correctly in your larger proof that the expression (1 : ğ•œ) â€¢ (x' : E) does not give an error, but one_smul ğ•œ (b := x') does? That is caused because you have only a SMul ğ•œ E instance available but need MulAction ğ•œ E.

Anne Baanen said:

Do I understand correctly in your larger proof that the expression (1 : ğ•œ) â€¢ (x' : E) does not give an error, but one_smul ğ•œ (b := x') does? That is caused because you have only a SMul ğ•œ E instance available but need MulAction ğ•œ E.

In fact that part of the proof is that

  have c1 : f ((0 : ğ•œ ) â€¢ x + (1 : ğ•œ) â€¢ x') = f x' := by
      have l2 : (0 : ğ•œ ) â€¢ x + (1 : ğ•œ) â€¢ x' = (1 : ğ•œ) â€¢ x' := by
        simp
        sorry
      have l3 : (1 : ğ•œ ) â€¢ x' = x' := by
        sorry

      have l4 : (0 : ğ•œ ) â€¢ x + (1 :ğ•œ) â€¢ x' = x' := by
        rw[l2]
        rw[l3]
      rw[l4]

In this part x':E is not clearly written, but it is correct. As for why rw[one_smul ğ•œ (b := x')] can't work, I don't quite understand

@tsuki hao, unfortunately it's impossible to debug your issues without more context. If you can't paste a complete #mwe for whatever reason, can you at least paste the goal view at the point where the lemma fails to apply?

Eric Wieser said:

tsuki hao, unfortunately it's impossible to debug your issues without more context. If you can't paste a complete #mwe for whatever reason, can you at least paste the goal view at the point where the lemma fails to apply?

The whole proof involves a lot of definitions and lemmas. What I need to prove now is the above c1. As for the error, I have already given it above.

A #mwe does not have to be short. A lot of definitions and lemmas are fine. Sorry long proofs and post a #mwe . You are posting code which we can't run and this makes it much much harder to diagnose your problems (and it also wastes people's time because they come up with incorrect conjectures about what the problem is, explain how to solve it, and then it turns out that it's all irrelevant).

These codes look like this after simplification. My doubts are the last two sorry. What I need to remind is that after I changed the proof of aux1 to sorry, there seems to be an error in hf, but you have completely proved that the error is not correct after playing aux1. does not exist. But the proof of aux1 is too long and I can't paste it

import Mathlib.Tactic
import Mathlib.Analysis.Convex.Function
import Mathlib.Data.Real.EReal
import Mathlib.Topology.Basic
import Mathlib.Topology.Sequences
import Mathlib.Order.Filter.Basic
import Mathlib.Order.LiminfLimsup
import Mathlib.Data.Set.Basic
import Mathlib.Logic.Basic
import Mathlib.Order.Basic
import Mathlib.Topology.Sets.Closeds
import Mathlib.Topology.Bases

import Mathlib.Order.Bounds.Basic
import Mathlib.Analysis.Convex.Basic
import Mathlib.Topology.SubsetProperties
import Mathlib.Analysis.NormedSpace.Ray
import Mathlib.Topology.MetricSpace.Basic
import Mathlib.Analysis.NormedSpace.ENorm


open EReal Function Topology Filter Set TopologicalSpace


variable {ğ•œ E Î± Î² Î¹ : Type _}

variable [LinearOrderedRing ğ•œ]

variable [AddCommMonoid E]

variable (ğ•œ)
variable (s : Set E) (f : E â†’ EReal) [MulAction ğ•œ E]

def properfun : Prop :=
  (âˆƒ x âˆˆ s, f x < âŠ¤) âˆ§ (âˆ€ x âˆˆ s, f x > âŠ¥)

def dom : Set E :=
  {x | f x < âŠ¤} âˆ© s

def sublevel (r : EReal) : Set E :=
  { x âˆˆ s | f x â‰¤ r }

def epigraph : Set <| E Ã— EReal :=
  {p : E Ã— EReal | p.1 âˆˆ s âˆ§ f p.1 â‰¤ p.2}
-- {p : E Ã— Î² | p.1 âˆˆ s âˆ§ f p.1 â‰¤ p.2}

variable [TopologicalSpace ğ•œ] [PseudoMetricSpace E] [TopologicalSpace EReal]

variable [SequentialSpace E] [SequentialSpace EReal] [SequentialSpace <| E Ã— EReal]

variable [OrderTopology EReal]

variable [FirstCountableTopology E] [FirstCountableTopology EReal]

def closedfunc : Prop :=
  IsClosed <| epigraph s f

def lo_semicontinuous : Prop :=
  âˆ€ x âˆˆ s, f x â‰¤ (liminf f <| ğ“[s] x)

section IsClosed

variable (s : Closeds E) (f : E â†’ EReal) [SMul ğ•œ E] [SMul ğ•œ EReal]

theorem aux12 (hf : âˆ€ (r : EReal), IsClosed <| sublevel s f r) : lo_semicontinuous s f := by
  sorry

theorem aux23 (hf : lo_semicontinuous s f) : closedfunc s f := by sorry

theorem aux31 (hf : closedfunc s f) : âˆ€ (r : EReal), IsClosed <| sublevel s f r := by sorry

theorem aux31' (s : Set E) (f : E â†’ EReal) (hf : closedfunc s f) : âˆ€ (r : EReal), IsClosed <| sublevel s f r := by
  intro r
  rw [â† isSeqClosed_iff_isClosed]
  intro x x' xns cx
  have : (x', r) âˆˆ epigraph s f :=
    IsClosed.isSeqClosed hf (fun n => xns n) (Tendsto.prod_mk_nhds cx tendsto_const_nhds)
  exact mem_setOf.mpr (mem_setOf.mp this)

theorem eq12 :  (âˆ€ (r : EReal), IsClosed <| sublevel s f r) â†” lo_semicontinuous s f :=
  âŸ¨fun a => aux12 s f a, fun a => aux31 s f (aux23 s f a)âŸ©

theorem eq23 : lo_semicontinuous s f â†” closedfunc s f :=
  âŸ¨fun a => aux23 s f a, fun a => aux12 s f (aux31 s f a)âŸ©

theorem eq31 : closedfunc s f â†” (âˆ€ (r : EReal), IsClosed <| sublevel s f r):=
  âŸ¨fun a => aux31 s f a , fun a => aux23 s f (aux12 s f a)âŸ©



end IsClosed


open Metric

variable [Preorder E]
variable [LinearOrderedRing ğ•œ] [SeminormedAddCommGroup E] [Module ğ•œ E]

variable [ProperSpace E]
variable [T2Space E]

variable (pf : properfun s f) (cf : closedfunc s f)

lemma l1 (r : EReal) (h : (sublevel s f r).Nonempty): sInf {f x | x âˆˆ sublevel s f r} = sInf {f x | x âˆˆ s} := by
  sorry

theorem aux2 (h : âˆƒ r, (sublevel s f r).Nonempty âˆ§ Bounded (sublevel s f r)) :
  {x âˆˆ s | âˆ€ y âˆˆ s, f x â‰¤ f y}.Nonempty âˆ§ IsCompact {x âˆˆ s | âˆ€ y âˆˆ s, f x â‰¤ f y} := by
    sorry

theorem aux1 (h : Bounded (dom s f)) :
  {x âˆˆ s | âˆ€ y âˆˆ s, f x â‰¤ f y}.Nonempty âˆ§ IsCompact {x âˆˆ s | âˆ€ y âˆˆ s, f x â‰¤ f y} := by
    sorry

variable [Module ğ•œ E]
variable [SMul ğ•œ E]
variable (s : Set E) (f : E â†’ EReal) [MulAction ğ•œ E]

variable (hs : Convex ğ•œ s)
def strong_quasi : Prop :=
  âˆ€ â¦ƒxâ¦„, x âˆˆ s â†’ âˆ€ â¦ƒyâ¦„, y âˆˆ s â†’ x â‰  y â†’ âˆ€ â¦ƒa b : ğ•œâ¦„, 0 â‰¤ a â†’ 0 â‰¤ b â†’ a + b = 1 â†’ f (a â€¢ x + b â€¢ y) < max (f x) (f y)


variable (s : Set E) (f : E â†’ EReal) [MulAction ğ•œ E]
variable (hs : s.Nonempty) (hs' : IsCompact s) (hs'' : Convex ğ•œ s)
variable (hf : properfun s f) (hf' : closedfunc s f) (hf'' : strong_quasi ğ•œ s f)


theorem exist_uniqueness : âˆƒ! x', x' âˆˆ s âˆ§ âˆ€ x âˆˆ s \ {x'}, f x' < f x := by
  have : {x âˆˆ s | âˆ€ y âˆˆ s, f x â‰¤ f y}.Nonempty âˆ§ IsCompact {x âˆˆ s | âˆ€ y âˆˆ s, f x â‰¤ f y} := by
    apply aux1 s f hf hf'
    exact Bounded.mono (inter_subset_right {x | f x < âŠ¤} s) (IsCompact.bounded hs')
  rcases this.1 with âŸ¨x', xs', hx'âŸ©
  have uniq : {x âˆˆ s | âˆ€ y âˆˆ s, f x â‰¤ f y} = {x'} := by
    rw [Set.eq_singleton_iff_nonempty_unique_mem]
    constructor
    Â· exact this.1
    intro x xs
    by_contra xneq
    push_neg at xneq
    have eq : max (f x) (f x') = f x' := by
      apply max_eq_right (xs.2 x' xs')

    have h1 : âˆ€ â¦ƒa b : ğ•œâ¦„, 0 â‰¤ a â†’ 0 â‰¤ b â†’ a + b = 1 â†’ f (a â€¢ x + b â€¢ x') < f x' := by
      intro a b lea leb ab
      apply Eq.trans_gt eq
      exact hf'' xs.1 xs' xneq lea leb ab

    have h2 : f ((0 : ğ•œ ) â€¢ x + (1 :ğ•œ) â€¢ x') < f x' := by
      have m1 : (0 : ğ•œ ) â‰¤ (0 : ğ•œ ):= by exact Eq.ge rfl
      have m2 : (0 : ğ•œ ) â‰¤ (1 : ğ•œ) := by simp
      have m3 : (0 : ğ•œ ) + (1 : ğ•œ) = (1 :ğ•œ) := by apply zero_add
      exact h1 (a := (0 : ğ•œ )) (b := (1 :ğ•œ)) m1 m2 m3

    have c1 : f ((0 : ğ•œ ) â€¢ x + (1 : ğ•œ) â€¢ x') = f x' := by
      have l2 : (0 : ğ•œ ) â€¢ x + (1 : ğ•œ) â€¢ x' = (1 : ğ•œ) â€¢ x' := by
        simp
        sorry
      have l3 : (1 : ğ•œ ) â€¢ x' = x' := by
        sorry

      have l4 : (0 : ğ•œ ) â€¢ x + (1 :ğ•œ) â€¢ x' = x' := by
        rw[l2]
        rw[l3]
      rw[l4]

    have l1 : f x' < f x' := by
      rw[c1] at h2
      apply h2
    have h3 : f x' â‰  f x' := by
      apply ne_of_lt l1
    exact h3 rfl

  use x'
  constructor
  Â· constructor
    Â· exact xs'
    intro x xns
    have : f x' â‰¤ f x := hx' x xns.1
    rcases lt_or_eq_of_le this with hlt | heq
    Â· exact hlt
    exfalso
    exact xns.2 (Eq.subset uniq âŸ¨xns.1, fun y ys => Eq.trans_le (Eq.symm heq) (hx' y ys)âŸ©)
  intro x âŸ¨xs, hxâŸ©
  by_cases hxs : x âˆˆ {x | x = x'}
  Â· exact hxs
  exfalso
  have : x' âˆˆ s \ {x} := by
    constructor
    Â· exact xs'
    simp only [mem_singleton_iff]
    simp only [setOf_eq_eq_singleton, mem_singleton_iff] at hxs
    exact Iff.mpr ne_comm hxs
  exact not_lt_of_ge (hx' x xs) (hx x' this)
tsuki hao has marked this topic as resolved.

I get

scratch37.lean:131:19
application type mismatch
  aux1 s f hf
argument
  hf
has type
  properfun s f : Prop
but is expected to have type
  Metric.Bounded (dom s f) : Prop

in the proof of exist_uniqueness
